title: Binance Is Said to Be Likely to Walk Away from Deal to Buy FTX
description: The crypto exchange is expected to walk away from deal to buy a collapsing competitor following a review of its structure and books, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: What's Ahead for Transportation
description: This special report explores what’s ahead for transportation, from the weird-looking planes that could fly you on vacation to the ways e-bikes could change our cities

title: Lyft-Backed Plan to Tax Rich for Green Initiatives Fails in California
description: Voters rejected a ballot measure aimed to raise more money to promote electric vehicles and fight wildfires.

title: Spyware Scandals Prompt Calls for Further Bans in Europe
description: A Europe-wide moratorium on surveillance software such as NSO Group’s Pegasus and similar products is needed to clamp down on abuses, according to a draft report from European Union lawmakers.

title: These Next Generation Headphones Don't Even Go in Your Ears
description: Equipped with bone conduction technology, these headphones offer a robust sound profile without obstructing your ear canal. They make for great running companions.

title: Twitter Launches Gray 'Official' Label to Verify Certain Accounts
description: Designation confers authenticity on the account and differs from the for-purchase blue check mark.

title: Can You Leave Twitter and Still Get Twitter? I Tried Mastodon.
description: As Elon Musk takes over Twitter, many are checking out this alternative. It could be the future of social media—if you can figure it out. Here’s a guide.

title: IBM Unveils New Chip in Push to Realize Quantum Computing's Promise
description: ‘We’re getting closer and closer,’ said Director of IBM Research Dario Gil

title: Facebook Parent Meta to Cut 11,000 Jobs
description: Meta Platforms said it would cut more than 11,000 workers, or 13% of staff, embarking on the company’s first broad restructuring to cope with a slumping digital-ad market and falling stock price.

title: Entrepreneur Caught in the Middle of U.S.-China Chip War
description: An American’s vision to build a global semiconductor player in China has been thrown into uncertainty as U.S. restrictions undermine the global industry integration he celebrated.

title: Chip-Making Juggernaut TSMC Eyes Multibillion-Dollar Factory Expansion
description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, the world’s largest contract chip maker, plans to announce a second multibillion-dollar factory in Arizona.

title: Elon Musk Sells Tesla Stock Worth Nearly $4 Billion
description: The sale this month of 19.5 million shares came after the billionaire completed his $44 billion purchase of Twitter.
